name: Hotel Mulia Senayan

reviews.text: The rooms are large, pretentious with a profundity of furniture that you are never going to use. Maybe they were having a bad week but the service was a shocker. I was there for 5 days and I began to wonder how many times they could get my order wrong. How many times they would interrupt a conversation over breakfast with my bill? How many times the “all-for-show” security would let me beep my way through the metal detector? And does every single member of the staff that passes me have to greet me? 5 Star? I think not.
reviews.title: Stop greeting me and do your job right!

reviews.text: Smiles, everywhere when entering, eating, drinking and leaving the piece of luxury in Jakarta. All for an affordable price. The hotel complex offers a wide range of restaurants and shops. Rooms are big and with positive "feng shui" or "energy". If you don't like living in refrigerators, you would need to switch of the aircon and your room would still be with a comfortable climate. Mulia is too cold, and I would advise management and guests to reduce energy consumption by lowering or switching off the aircon system.
reviews.title: Smile like Silk

reviews.text: The hotel is situated very centrally; relatively easy access from and to the airport and major companies and government agencies.
reviews.title: Beautiful oasis from the hustle and bustle

reviews.text: Hotel staff to be slightly alert for arriving guests and should help more actively with getting through the high security. Guest should not be requested to lift their own suitcases and bags. A helping hand would be a proper reflection of the hospitality inside the hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVE this hotel!

reviews.text: Worthwile to get you and your partner for an exciting disco/pub at the DJ Bar with live music. A place to smoke a good cigar, but some parts are too smokey. Fun assured.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with taste of local feel

reviews.text: My main hotel in Jakarta. Standard rooms are much bigger than normal hotel room, with a large sofa as well. I am picky about beds,, and i have no complaints on their large firm beds. Bathroom amenities are generic non-designer branded but more than adequate for business travelers. Service is great at front desk, and restaurants, always with a smile, even at the traffic jammed breakfast buffet. They used to provide iron & ironing board in room; but housekeeping delivers quickly. Complimentary massage is great add-on touch at the end of a busy day. Only drawback is there are no malls beside the hotel.
reviews.title: Great room and service

reviews.text: Aircon is set to very very cold and can't be adjusted at all. Room service is pathetic. Two days ago I ordered breakfast which didn't arrive for an hour. Then I was told that no order had been placed! Tonight ordered dinner which came after one hour, only it was someone else's dinner order, not what I had order! Hopeless!
reviews.title: Don't stay here unless you enjoy being cold and hungry.

reviews.text: The Mulia is a great hotel in a very handy location just far enough from the financial district to be practical.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: It has quality rooms, an excellent Club lounge, and excellent security which unfortunately has become a necessity in Jakarta.
reviews.title: outstanding

reviews.text: I love staying here so am happy it recommend it to all.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Restaurants - avoid Club Rooms

reviews.text: I've stayed here many times now. The service is always very efficient. They also throw in a free 1-hr massage with room bookings. The restaurants are very good, especially the Chinese restaurant.
reviews.title: Very posh hotel

reviews.text: It may be a bit pricey, but you pay for what you get! Luxury at its best in Indonesia.
reviews.title: The best Hotel in Jakarta

reviews.text: This Hotel is the best in Jakarta by far.
reviews.title: My Favorite Hotel in Asia!

reviews.text: It is located near two big shopping mals and a golf course and some main roads.
reviews.title: Grand Oasis in the City

reviews.text: The best Japanese restaurant is inside the Hotel (Endogin) and the "Cafe" restaurant is also very good with many different types of food.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Great place to stay in Jakarta. I use to stay there when I travel to Jakarta.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Jakarta

reviews.text: The hotel decoration is wonderful. The rooms as great.
reviews.title: Clean, modern, well-located and with superb service

reviews.text: The service is excellent, enjoy the loyalty program to be upgraded.
reviews.title: Great service, rooms and foods

reviews.text: The breakfeast choice is great.
reviews.title: Gran prix included at no extra charge!

reviews.text: Do not miss the Edogin (Japanese restaurant) and the in-room massages ! The spa is also excellent.
reviews.title: Great modern & central hotel

description: Located in the heart of Jakarta, the five-star, 40-storey Hotel Mulia Senayan boasts 996 tastefully decorated and well-appointed rooms and suites to satisfy the needs of both the business and leisure traveler alike. The hotel commands unobstructed views of 18-hole. Senayan Golf Course and Jakarta's skyline with easy access from the toll road to Soekarno-Hatta airport which can be reached from the hotel in 25 minutes.
